item.title: [DISTRELEC-6340] Different results for “All” and the 5 categories selected
item.description:
Different results for the same search query when only checkbox “All” is selected or when “All” is unselected and the rest 5 categories are selected.
We should have the same search result.

See screenshots I & II
item.summary: Different results for “All” and the 5 categories selected

comments.comment:
Hi Daniela

The results are different because, when the entry "All" is selected, we dont add any filters in the background. We just search for the search string without any filters. If we select all the filters, we add the filters to the search request. This changes the result.

What we can do is, adding always all the filters to the search request when the option "All" is selected. Would that be helpful? But take care, if we do that, the user will not be able anymore to search without any filters.

Cheers
Will

"All" and selecting all the five categories should have exactly the same result list - cause what is in all the five categories should also be contained in "all". Otherwise: Where do the products come from, which are visible when selecting "all" but are gone when you select all categories?

As discussed, when selecting all the filter options, we modify the request to use no filters, just the search string.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5920] Registration - VAT Review
item.description:
In this ticket the different VAT-Formats will be reviewed per country and according validations & descriptions will be specified below.
Knowledge-base: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VAT_identification_number

Specification

  1. The VAT-ID Form-field(Screenshot point 1) should be pre-filled with the values from(Form-field) from the list below. The filled text should be greyed out and dissapear as soon as the form-field is clicked.
  2. The text in the Info-Box(Screenshot point 2) should be replaced with the relating values(Hint) from the list below.

NOTE: Only fill values from below which are marked bold.

Countries

  • CH(en):
    • Description: VAT number
    • Abbrevation: VAT
    • Format: CHE 9 + numeric digits e.g. CHE-123.456.789
    • Form-field: CHE-123456789
    • Hint: 'CHE-' followed by 9 numeric digits, e.g. CHE-123456789
  • CH(de):
    • Description: Mehrwertsteuernummer
    • Abbrevation: MWST
    • Format: CHE 9-stellig z.B. CHE-123.456.789
    • Form-field: CHE-123456789
    • Hint: 'CHE-' gefolgt von 9 Ziffern, z.B. CHE-123456789
  • CH(fr):
    • Description: Taxe sur la Valeur Ajoutée
    • Abbrevation: TVA
    • Format: CHE suivi de 9 chiffres Exemple CHE-123.456.789
    • Form-field: CHE-123456789
    • Hint: CHE suivi de 9 chiffres Exemple CHE-123.456.789
  • DE(de):
    • Description: Umsatzsteuer-Identifikationsnummer
    • Abbrevation: USt-IdNr.
    • Format: DE gefolgt von 9-stelliger Zahl z.B. DE123456789
    • Form-field: DE123456789
    • Hint: 'DE' gefolgt von 9 Ziffern, z.B. DE123456789
  • DE(en):
    • Description: Umsatzsteuer-Identifikationsnummer
    • Abbrevation: USt-IdNr.
    • Format: DE followed by 9 digits, e.g. DE123456789
    • Form-field: DE123456789
    • Hint: 'DE' followed by 9 digits, e.g. DE123456789
  • AT:
    • Description: Umsatzsteuer-Identifikationsnummer
    • Abbrecation: UID
    • Format: 'ATU'+8 Zahlen, – z.B. ATU12345678
    • Form-field: ATU12345678
    • Hint: 'ATU' gefolgt von 8 Ziffern, z.B. ATU12345678
  • IT:
    • Description: Partita IVA
    • Abbrevation: P.IVA
    • Format: 11 digits
    • Form-field: 12345678901
    • Hint: Stays as it actually is.
  • LT:
    • Description: PVM mokėtojo kodas
    • Abbrevation: PVM kodas
    • Format: 9 arba 12 skaitmenų
    • Form-field: 123456789012
    • Hint: 9 arba 12 skaitmenų
  • HU:
    • Description: Közösségi adószám
    • Abbrevation: ANUM
    • Format: 8 számjegy (a magyar adószám első 8 száma), pl. HU12345678
    • Form-field: HU12345678
    • Hint: 'HU' + 8 számjegy (a magyar adószám első 8 száma), pl. HU12345678
  • RO:
    • Description: Codul de identificare fiscală
    • Abbrevation: CIF
    • Format: Consista din 2 pana la 10 cifre
    • Form-field: 1234567890
    • Hint: Consista din 2 pana la 10 cifre
  • CZ:
    • Description: Daňové identifikační číslo
    • Abbrevation: DIČ
    • Format: 'CZ', následuje 8-10 číslic, například CZ1234567890
    • Form-field: CZ1234567890
    • Hint: 'CZ', následuje 8-10 číslic, například CZ1234567890
  • SK:
    • Description: Identifikačné číslo pre daň z pridanej hodnoty
    • Abbrevation: IČ DPH
    • Format: 'SK', nasleduje 10 číslic, napríklad SK1234567890
    • Form-field: SK1234567890
    • Hint: 'SK', nasleduje 10 číslic, napríklad SK1234567890

I quickly had a look a this ticket. I think this is still not properly solved.

SAP requires a 6 characters postal code. But the current implementation accept 6 but also 5 characters. The SAP call fails in case of a 5 chars (e.g. 12345):

<faultText>SAP ERR:ZDGT_GEN_SD,000 :Postal code 12345 must have the length 6</faultText>

@Surendra: Two things you have to check:

(1) The space in the validation RegEx is optional (not mandatory). That's why a 5 character code is accepted, too.

register.postalCode.validationPattern       = ^[0-9]{3}\\s?[0-9]{2}$

(2) Attentions: There is a second validation RegEx used for postal code validation during address modification in the MyAccount section (https://test.distrelec.se/my-account/addresses)
This validation pattern is currently different (but should be the same):

address.postalCode.validationPattern      = ^[0-9]{5}$

please make this validation for all the forms.

currently Customer Registration forms were corrected, but Add a new Address, Postal Code field is not yet corrected.
Please review in the next deployment.
